intro: Seseli scaberrimum, commonly known as the rough seseli, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a slender, branched stem. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps. Seseli scaberrimum is often found in open woodlands and along rocky slopes, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
